com.bitplane.xt

Class DatasetDimensions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bitplane.xt.DatasetDimensions

  • public final class DatasetDimensions
extends Object
    Dimensions of an ImarisDataset.

    Stores the 5D XYZCT dimensions of the underlying Imaris dataset, as well as the mapping from Imaris to ImgLib2 dimensions.

    In Imaris, datasets are always 5D: for example, a 2D dataset (without channel or time) is represented as 5D with size=1 along Z, C, T axes. In ImgLib2, there is a distinction between a 2D image and a 5D image with size=1 along the 3rd, 4th, and 5th dimension. Therefore, there are several ways to represent such an Imaris dataset in ImgLib2. Which way is chosen is specified by the mapping from Imaris to ImgLib2 dimensions, as well as (redundantly) the #getAxisOrder axis order (of the ImgLib2 representation).

    Author:
    Tobias Pietzsch

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatasetDimensions

        public DatasetDimensions(int sx,
                         int sy,
                         int sz,
                         int sc,
                         int st)
        Create DatasetDimensions.

        Sizes sâ‰¤0 indicate missing dimensions. For example, new DatasetDimension(new UnsignedByteType(), 300, 200, 0, 0, 0) represents a 2D ImgLib2 image with axes [X,Y]. The size along missing dimensions (Z, C, T in this example) is set to s=1 on the Imaris side.

        Parameters:
        sx - size in X dimension
        sy - size in Y dimension
        sz - size in Z dimension
        sc - size in C (channel) dimension
        st - size in T (time) dimension

      • DatasetDimensions

        public DatasetDimensions(Imaris.IDataSetPrx dataset,
                         ImarisAxesOptions.Axis... includeAxes)
                  throws Imaris.Error
        Create DatasetDimensions from the given Imaris IDataSetPrx.

        The optional includeAxes arguments specify which axes must be included (at least) in the ImgLib2 representation.

        In Imaris, datasets are always 5D: for example, a 2D dataset (without channel or time) is represented as 5D with size=1 along Z, C, T axes. In ImgLib2, there is a distinction between a 2D image and a 5D image with size=1 along the 3rd, 4th, and 5th dimension. Therefore, there are several ways to represent such an Imaris dataset in ImgLib2. Which way is chosen is specified by the mapping from Imaris to ImgLib2 dimensions, as well as (redundantly) the #getAxisOrder axis order (of the ImgLib2 representation).

        By default, axes Z, C, and T are not represented in ImgLib2 if the dataset size along those axes is s=1. By specifying these axes as includeAxes arguments, this can be overridden. For example, an Imaris dataset with size {100, 100, 1, 1, 1} would be represented as a 2D ImgLib2 image with size {100, 100}. Specifying includeAxes = Z, T, would result in a 4D ImgLib2 image with size {100,100,1,1}.

        Throws:
        Imaris.Error

    • Method Detail

      • getMapDimensions

        public int[] getMapDimensions()
        Get the mapping between dimension indices in the Imaris and in the ImgLib2 representation.

        The returned int[5] array maps Imaris dimension indices to imglib2 dimension indices. If i is dimension index from Imaris (0..4 means X,Y,Z,C,T) then mapDimensions[i] is the corresponding imglib2 dimension, e.g., in imagePyramid.

        For imglib2 dimensions, Imaris dimensions with size=1 maybe skipped. E.g., for a XYC image mapDimensions = {0,1,-1,2,-1}.

      • getImarisDimensions

        public int[] getImarisDimensions()
        Returns the 5D dimensions of the dataset on the imaris side.

      • getAxisOrder

        public AxisOrder getAxisOrder()
        Returns the AxisOrder of the ImgLib2 representation. The returned value will be one of XY, XYZ, XYC, XYT, XYZC, XYZT, XYCT, XYZCT.

      • dimX

        public int dimX()
        Get the index of the X dimension in the ImgLib2 representation. (This is always 0.)

      • sizeX

        public int sizeX()
        Returns the size along X.

      • dimY

        public int dimY()
        Get the index of the Y dimension in the ImgLib2 representation. (This is always 1.)

      • sizeY

        public int sizeY()
        Returns the size along Y.

      • hasZ

        public boolean hasZ()
        Returns true if the ImgLib2 representation has a Z dimension.

      • dimZ

        public int dimZ()
        Get the index of the Z dimension in the ImgLib2 representation.
        Returns:
        the index of the Z dimension, or -1 if the ImgLib2 representation doesn't have Z

      • sizeZ

        public int sizeZ()
        Returns the size along Z. If the ImgLib2 representation does not have a Z dimension, returns 1.

      • hasC

        public boolean hasC()
        Returns true if the ImgLib2 representation has a channel dimension.

      • dimC

        public int dimC()
        Get the index of the channel dimension in the ImgLib2 representation.
        Returns:
        the index of the channel dimension, or -1 if the ImgLib2 representation doesn't have channels

      • sizeC

        public int sizeC()
        Returns the number of channels. If the ImgLib2 representation does not have channels, returns 1.

      • hasT

        public boolean hasT()
        Returns true if the ImgLib2 representation has a time dimension.

      • dimT

        public int dimT()
        Get the index of the time dimension in the ImgLib2 representation.
        Returns:
        the index of the time dimension, or -1 if the ImgLib2 representation doesn't have a time dimension.

      • sizeT

        public int sizeT()
        Returns the number of timepoints. If the ImgLib2 representation does not have timepoints, return 1.
